means: healing and early afterload reducing therapy 愈合和早期后负荷还原疗法
health education and research trial 健康教育和研究试验
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 哈特 Hart的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"中心"之意。
means: center ： 指三维空间的中心点，也可比喻抽象事物的中心。
middle ： 一般指时间、空间或过程两端间等距的部分。
heart ： 指事物最内部或最重要的部分，表地理位置时可与center换用。
core ： 指某事物固定的中心部分或最重要的核心部分。比喻意义指某物的精华。
midst ： 书面语用词，指在一个群体的深处或在某活动的进程中。

word_mean: 心脏，心：心肌构成的器官，维持血液循环。又称cor 〔NA〕。心分四腔，两心房和两心室。左心房自肺接受氧合的血，由左心房进入左心室，泵入主动脉，经动脉分支供应全身，右心房接受被组织消耗了氧的血，进入右心室，然后将血泵入肺，使血再度氧合。心的主要瓣膜有四：左心房与左心室之间的二尖瓣
右心房与右心室之间的三尖瓣
位于主动脉口的主动脉瓣
位于肺动脉口的肺动脉瓣。冠状动脉供应心脏自身的血液和营养
心，五脏之一，位居胸腔之内，膈之上，有心包卫护于外，其主要生理功能是主血脉、主神志，并与舌和汗液密切相关。

sentence.Network_en: Bob died of a heart attack, brought on by his lifestyle.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲍勃死于由他的生活方式引起的心脏病突发。

sentence.Network_en: Shirley's brother is now a consultant heart surgeon in Sweden.
sentence.Network_cn: 雪利的兄弟现在在瑞典做心脏外科高级顾问医师。

sentence.Network_en: Her husband had never before had any heart trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 她丈夫以前从来没得过任何心脏疾病。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...信息社会、全球化和终生学习的需要。在实施素质教育方面，可用“4个H“来概括，即“头（head）“，“心（heart）“，“手（hand“，“健康（health）“。所谓头，即强调培养大学生的精神素质，要求学生学会领导.

jx.jx_en_mean: of the type that one likes or understands best; sharing one's tastes
jx.jx_cn_mean: 合自己心意，称自己的心；与自己有相同爱好

phrase.cizu_name: close (或 dear) to (或 near) one's heart

jx.jx_en_mean: of deep interest and concern to one

jx.jx_cn_mean: 发自内心的（地）；诚心诚意的（地）

lj.lj_ly: their warmth and hospitality is right from the heart.
lj.lj_ls: 他们的热情好客是发自内心的。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 有一颗仁厚的心，有一颗金子般的心

phrase.cizu_name: have the heart to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. with negative]be insensitive or hard-hearted enough to do something

lj.lj_ly: I don't have the heart to tell her.

jx.jx_en_mean: be (or become) keenly involved in or committed to (an enterprise)

phrase.cizu_name: have one's heart in one's mouth
have one's heart in the right place

jx.jx_en_mean: used in allusion to extreme sentimentality
used in reference to emotional and intellectual support or commitment

lj.lj_ly: a campaign to win the hearts and minds of America's college students.
lj.lj_ls: 争取美国大学生全心支持的运动。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English heorte, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hart and German Herz, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin cor, cord- and Greek kēr, kardia

entry.def: Your heart is the organ in your chest that pumps the blood around your body. People also use heart to refer to the area of their chest that is closest to their heart.

example.ex: The bullet had passed less than an inch from Andrea's heart...
example.tran: 子弹在离安德烈亚的心脏不到一英寸的地方穿过。

example.ex: The only sound inside was the beating of his heart...
example.tran: 屋内唯一的声音就是他的心跳声。

entry.def: You can refer to someone's heart when you are talking about their deep feelings and beliefs.

example.ex: Alik's words filled her heart with pride...
example.tran: 亚利克的话让她心感自豪。

example.ex: I just couldn't bring myself to admit what I knew in my heart to be true.
example.tran: 我就是无法迫使自己承认心里知道的事实。

entry.def: You use heart when you are talking about someone's character and attitude towards other people, especially when they are kind and generous.

example.ex: She loved his brilliance and his generous heart...
example.tran: 她深爱他的才华横溢和古道热肠。

example.ex: She's got a good heart but she's calculating.
example.tran: 她心地善良，但却工于心计。

entry.def: If you refer to things of the heart, you mean love and relationships.

example.ex: This is an excellent time for affairs of the heart.
example.tran: 这是谈情说爱的绝佳时机。

entry.def: The heart of something is the most central and important part of it.

example.ex: The heart of the problem is supply and demand...
example.tran: 问题的核心是供求关系。

example.ex: Money lies at the heart of the debate over airline safety.
example.tran: 资金是空运安全争论中的实质问题。

entry.def: The heart of a place is its centre.

example.ex: ...a busy dentists' practice in the heart of London's West End.
example.tran: 位于伦敦西区中心的一个繁忙的牙科诊所

entry.def: The heart of a lettuce, cabbage, or other vegetable is its centre leaves.
A heart is a shape that is used as a symbol of love: ♥.

example.ex: ...heart-shaped chocolates.
example.tran: 心形巧克力

entry.def: Hearts is one of the four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more red symbols in the shape of a heart.

entry.tran: 全心全意地;真心实意地
entry.def: If you feel or believe something with all your heart, you feel or believe it very strongly.

example.ex: My own family I loved with all my heart.
example.tran: 我真心实意地爱我全家人。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person at heart, you mean that that is what they are really like, even though they may seem very different.

example.ex: He was a very gentle boy at heart.
example.tran: 他实际上是个非常温柔的男生。

entry.tran: 十分关心（某人的利益或福祉）
entry.def: If you say that someone has your interests or your welfare at heart, you mean that they are concerned about you and that is why they are doing something.

example.ex: She told him she only had his interests at heart.
example.tran: 她告诉他自己万事都是为了他好。

entry.tran: （通常指因感情破裂而）使…伤心，使…心碎
entry.def: If someone breaks your heart, they make you very sad and unhappy, usually because they end a love affair or close relationship with you.

entry.tran: （尤指因对他人的苦难无能为力而）使…伤心，使…心碎
entry.def: If something breaks your heart, it makes you feel very sad and depressed, especially because people are suffering but you can do nothing to help them.

example.ex: It really breaks my heart to see them this way.
example.tran: 看到他们这个样子可真让我伤心。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a broken heart, you mean that they are very sad, for example because a love affair has ended unhappily.

example.ex: She never recovered from her broken heart.
example.tran: 她心上的伤再也没能愈合。

entry.def: If you know something such as a poem by heart, you have learned it so well that you can remember it without having to read it.

example.ex: Mack knew this passage by heart.
example.tran: 麦克会背这一段。

entry.def: If someone has a change of heart, their attitude towards something changes.

example.ex: Several brokers have had a change of heart about prospects for the company...
example.tran: 几位经纪人对该公司前景的看法已经有所改变。

example.ex: Why the change of heart?
example.tran: 为什么变了态度？

entry.def: If something such as a subject or project is close to your heart or near to your heart, it is very important to you and you are very interested in it and concerned about it.

example.ex: Animal welfare is a subject very close to my heart.
example.tran: 动物福利是我非常关注的一个问题。

entry.def: If you can do something to your heart's content, you can do it as much as you want.

example.ex: I was delighted to be able to eat my favorite dishes to my heart's content.
example.tran: 我很高兴能够痛痛快快地吃我最喜爱的菜。

entry.tran: 我发誓（所说的是真的）/你敢发誓（所说的是真的）吗？
entry.def: You can say 'cross my heart' when you want someone to believe that you are telling the truth. You can also ask 'cross your heart?', when you are asking someone if they are really telling the truth.

example.ex: And I won't tell any of the other girls anything you tell me about it. I promise, cross my heart.
example.tran: 我不会把你告诉我的事告诉任何其他女孩。我发誓，保证不会。

entry.def: If you say something from the heart or from the bottom of your heart, you sincerely mean what you say.

example.ex: He spoke with confidence, from the heart...
example.tran: 他的话充满信心，发自心坎。

example.ex: I don't want to go away without thanking you from the bottom of my heart.
example.tran: 我离开之前一定要先衷心地感谢你。

entry.def: If something gives you heart, it makes you feel more confident or happy about something.

example.ex: It gave me heart to see one thug get what he deserves.
example.tran: 看到一个恶棍罪有应得真是大快我心。

entry.def: If you want to do something but do not have the heart to do it, you do not do it because you know it will make someone unhappy or disappointed.

example.ex: We knew all along but didn'thave the heart to tell her.
example.tran: 我们一直都知道，但却不忍心告诉她。

entry.def: If you believe or know something in your heart of hearts, that is what you really believe or think, even though it may sometimes seem that you do not.

example.ex: I know in my heart of hearts that I am the right man for that mission.
example.tran: 我心里深知我是完成那项任务的合适人选。

entry.def: If your heart isn't in the thing you are doing, you have very little enthusiasm for it, usually because you are depressed or are thinking about something else.

example.ex: I tried to learn some lines but my heart wasn't really in it.
example.tran: 我想要背几句台词，但我的心根本不在那上面。

entry.def: If you lose heart, you become sad and depressed and are no longer interested in something, especially because it is not progressing as you would like.

example.ex: He appealed to his countrymen not to lose heart.
example.tran: 他呼吁自己的同胞不要丧失信心。

entry.def: If you lose your heart to someone, you fall in love with them.

entry.tran: 激动非常;焦急万分;害怕得要命
entry.def: If your heart is in your mouth, you feel very excited, worried, or frightened.

example.ex: My heart was in my mouth when I walked into her office.
example.tran: 我走进她的办公室时，紧张得心都到了喉咙口。

entry.def: If you open your heart or pour out your heart to someone, you tell them your most private thoughts and feelings.

example.ex: She opened her heart to millions yesterday and told how she came close to suicide.
example.tran: 她昨天在数成百万人面前倾吐心声，讲述了自己是如何差点轻生的。

entry.tran: （尽管有其他缺点但）心地善良，心眼儿好
entry.def: If you say that someone's heart is in the right place, you mean that they are kind, considerate, and generous, although you may disapprove of other aspects of their character.

example.ex: He is a bit of a tearaway but his heart is in the right place.
example.tran: 他是有点像个阿飞，但心眼儿不错。

entry.tran: 一心想要得到;一心想要做
entry.def: If you have set your heart on something, you want it very much or want to do it very much.

example.ex: He had always set his heart on a career in the fine arts.
example.tran: 他一直以来都一心想把美术作为自己的事业。

entry.def: If you wear your heart on your sleeve, you openly show your feelings or emotions rather than keeping them hidden.

entry.tran: 全心全意地;尽心尽力地
entry.def: If you put your heart and soul into something, you do it with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy.

example.ex: He will always be successful when he puts his mind to something, because he puts his heart and soul into it.
example.tran: 当他专心想干某件事时，他总是能成功，因为他会全心全意地投入其中。

entry.def: If you take heart from something, you are encouraged and made to feel optimistic by it.

entry.tran: 对…耿耿于怀;为…感到不快
entry.def: If you take something to heart, for example someone's behaviour, you are deeply affected and upset by it.

example.ex: If someone says something critical I take it to heart.
example.tran: 如果有人提出批评，我会十分介意。

means.word_mean: 1. the locus of feelings and intuitions;

sentences.sentence: "in your heart you know it is true"

means.word_mean: 2. the hollow muscular organ located behind the sternum and between the lungs; its rhythmic contractions pump blood through the body;

sentences.sentence: "he stood still, his heart thumping wildly"
"you haven't got the heart for baseball"

means.word_mean: 4. an area that is approximately central within some larger region;

sentences.sentence: "it is in the center of town"
"they ran forward into the heart of the struggle"
"they were in the eye of the storm"

means.word_mean: 5. the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience;

sentences.sentence: "the heart and soul of the Republican Party"

means.word_mean: 6. an inclination or tendency of a certain kind;
7. a plane figure with rounded sides curving inward at the top and intersecting at the bottom; conventionally used on playing cards and valentines;

sentences.sentence: "he drew a heart and called it a valentine"

means.word_mean: 8. a firm rather dry variety meat (usually beef or veal);

sentences.sentence: "a five-pound beef heart will serve six"
"he had trouble expressing the affection he felt"

means.word_mean: 10. a playing card in the major suit of hearts;

auth_sentence.content: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.

auth_sentence.content: Luckily, Into Your Heart is unlikely to disappoint.
auth_sentence.res_content: Luckily, Into Your Heart is unlikely to disappoint.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Luckily, Into Your Heart is unlikely to disappoint.

auth_sentence.content: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.

Sentence.sentence: The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.

The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.
The team conducted a computer-based analysis to determine the impact a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt intake on rates of heart disease and death.
The learning paradox is at the heart of "productive failure".
trillion China holds in reserve, currency traders have a heart attack.
At the heart of the debate over illegal immigration lies one key question: are immigrants good or bad for the economy?

means.word_mean: 内心, 心肠; 爱心

sentences.en: His heart is full of goodwill to all men.
sentences.cn: 他心里对所有人都充满着爱心。

means.word_mean: 感情, 爱好, 爱情

sentences.en: He wrote her and declared his heart.
sentences.cn: 他给她写了信, 表述自己的爱慕之情。

sentences.en: I didn't have the heart to tell him the news.
sentences.cn: 我没有勇气把这消息告诉他。

sentences.en: They had reached the heart of the forest.
sentences.cn: 他们到了森林的中心地带。

sentences.en: The heart of the problem is a shortage of funds.
sentences.cn: 问题的关键是缺乏经费。

jushi.english: Every sudden emotion quickens the action of the heart.
jushi.chinese: 每件突如其来的令人激动的事情都能加快心房的跳动。

jushi.english: This matter is nearest to his heart.
